trans-unit.source: Represents controls that contain text.
The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> class may not provide for text features that exist only in a particular UI Automation provider.
For these unique and often advanced features, the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> class provides methods for a UI Automation client to access the corresponding native object model.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle"></xref> attribute of a text range.
Animations appear on the screen only; the animated text prints, but the animation effect does not.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.None>.
Identifies the [BackgroundColor](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/colors_9xiq.asp) attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle"></xref> attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle.None>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle"></xref> attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle.None>.

Identifies the `Culture` (<xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref>) attribute of a text range down to the sub-language level; for example, Frenchâ€“Switzerland (fr-CH) instead of French (fr).
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>.
The default value is the language of the application [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].
See <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)] for more detail on the language code format.
There might be cases where the server does not support the language tag or authors cannot use it.
In those cases the default applies.
Gets a text range that encloses the main text of a document.
Some auxiliary text such as headers, footnotes, or annotations might not be included.
Identifies the `FontName` attribute of a text range.
Example values for this attribute include "Arial Black" and "Arial Narrow".
The values for this attribute are non-localized.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.String>.
The default value is an `empty string`.
Identifies the `FontSize` attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the `FontWeight` attribute of a text range.
This attribute refers to the relative stroke, thickness, or boldness of a font.
This attribute is modeled after the `lfWeight` field in [GDI LOGFONT](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/fontext_1wmq.asp).

For consistency, the following values have been adopted from LOGFONT: 0=DontCare, 100=Thin, 200=ExtraLight or UltraLight, 300=Light, 400=Normal or Regular, 500=Medium, 600=SemiBold or DemiBold, 700=Bold, 800=ExtraBold or UltraBold, and 900=Heavy or Black.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the `ForegroundColor` ([COLORREF](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/colors_9xiq.asp)) attribute of a text range.
The value of this attribute is equivalent to the text or font color.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is `zero`.
Retrieves a collection of disjoint text ranges associated with the current text selection or selections.
If no text is selected, <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.GetSelection%2A> returns the degenerate text range (empty range) at the position of the system cursor (text insertion point).
If the system cursor (text insertion point) is not present, <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.GetSelection%2A> might return `null`.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.SupportedTextSelection%2A> property to test if text selection or positioning of the text insertion point is supported by the control.
A collection of disjoint text ranges.
The text container does not support text selection.
Retrieves an array of disjoint text ranges from a text container where each text range begins with the first partially visible line through to the end of the last partially visible line.

Disjoint text ranges may occur when any content of a text container is obscured by an overlapping window or other object, or when a text container with a multi-column layout has one or more columns partially scrolled out of view.
If no text is visible, a degenerate (empty) text range is returned.
This empty range can be returned if the text container is empty or when all text is scrolled out of view.
The collection of visible text ranges within the container or an empty array.
`Null` is never returned.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.HorizontalTextAlignment"></xref> attribute of a text range.
This attribute represents the horizontal text alignment applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.HorizontalTextAlignment>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.HorizontalTextAlignment.Left>
Identifies the `IndentationFirstLine` (<xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.TextIndent"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This attribute represents the first-line indentation in points (<xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit>) applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the `IndentationLeading`(<xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.TextIndent"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This attribute represents the leading indentation in points (<xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit>) applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the `IndentationTrailing`(<xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.TextIndent"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This attribute represents the trailing indentation in points (<xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit>) applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the `IsHidden` attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.
Identifies the `IsItalic` (<xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.
Identifies the `IsReadOnly` attribute of a text range.
This attribute represents the read-only state of the document associated with the calling text range.
If a document or file is read-only, but you can still edit it and save it as another file, the text is not considered read-only.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.
Identifies the `IsSubscript` (<xref href="System.Windows.FontVariants"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.
Identifies the `IsSuperscript` (<xref href="System.Windows.FontVariants"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.
Identifies the `MarginBottom` (<xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This attribute represents the bottom margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the `MarginLeading` (<xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This attribute represents the leading margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the `MarginTop` (<xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This attribute represents the top margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the `MarginTrailing` (<xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This attribute represents the trailing margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies whether the value of a given attribute varies over a text range in a rich edit control.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A> returns `TextPattern.MixedAttributeValue` to indicate this variation instead of a collection of attribute values.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Object>.
Identifies the `OutlineStyles` (<xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.OutlineStyles"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.OutlineStyles>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.OutlineStyles.None>.
Identifies the `OverlineColor` attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the `OverlineStyle` (<xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle.None>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern"></xref> pattern.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.

The pattern identifier is passed to methods such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPattern%2A> to retrieve the control pattern of interest from the specified <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
Retrieves a text range enclosing a child element such as an image, hyperlink, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xl](~/includes/tlasharptla-xl-md.md)] spreadsheet, or other embedded object.
If there is no text in the range where the child element exists, a degenerate (empty) range is returned.

The `childElement` parameter is either a child of the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> associated with a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> or from the array of children of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange>.
The enclosed object.
A range that spans the child element.
The child element is `null`.
The element is not a child of the text container.
Returns the degenerate (empty) text range nearest to the specified screen coordinates.

A text range that wraps a child object is returned if the screen coordinates are within the coordinates of an image, hyperlink, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xl](~/includes/tlasharptla-xl-md.md)] spreadsheet, or other embedded object.
Because hidden text is not ignored by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.RangeFromPoint%2A>, a degenerate range from the visible text closest to the given point is returned.
The location in screen coordinates.
A degenerate range nearest the specified location.
`Null` is never returned.
A given point is outside the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement"></xref> associated with the text pattern.
Identifies the `StrikethroughColor` attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the `StrikethroughStyle` (<xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle.None>.
Gets a value that specifies whether a text provider supports selection and, if so, the type of selection supported.
One of `None`, `Single`, or `Multiple` from <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.SupportedTextSelection"></xref>.
Identifies the `Tabs` attribute of a text range.
This attribute represents the collection of tab stops in points (<xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit>).
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are an array of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is an `empty` array.
Identifies the event raised whenever textual content is modified.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
Identifies the `TextFlowDirections` (<xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections.Default>.
Identifies the event raised when the text selection is modified.
Some text controls handle the text insertion point (cursor) as a zero-width text selection and might raise `TextSelectionChangedEvent` when the cursor is moved.

To follow cursor movements, UI Automation clients are advised to keep track of insertion point changes by listening for corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element events rather than depending on <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.TextSelectionChangedEvent>.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
Identifies the `UnderlineColor` attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the `UnderlineStyle` (<xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle"></xref>) attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle.None>.
